data.title: Josh Harris acquisition of Washington Commanders
data.meta_description: Davis Polk is advising Josh Harris and partners on the acquisition of the Washington Commanders NFL franchise from the Snyder family. The agreement is subject to NFL approval as well as the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.Josh Harris is an investor, business leader and philanthropist...
data.text:
Davis Polk is advising Josh Harris and partners on the acquisition of the Washington Commanders NFL franchise from the Snyder family. The agreement is subject to NFL approval as well as the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.

Josh Harris is an investor, business leader and philanthropist whose career spans private equity, sports, entertainment, impact and more. He is the founder of 26North, a next-generation, multi-asset class alternatives platform. Josh is also the Founder and Managing General Partner of Harris Blitzer Sports & Entertainment (HBSE). HSBEâ€™s portfolio includes the Philadelphia 76ers, New Jersey Devils, Prudential Center, two minor league teams, e-sports franchise Dignitas, the Sixers Innovation Lab and HBSEv, a venture fund investing in early-stage sports technology companies. He is also a General Partner of the Crystal Palace Football Club in the Premier League. Earlier, he co-founded and spent more than 30 years at Apollo Global Management.

The Washington Commanders are a professional American football team based in the Washington DC metropolitan area that competes in the National Football League.

The Davis Polk corporate team includes Chair and Managing Partner Neil Barr, partners Brian Wolfe and Darren M. Schweiger and associate Michael Senders. Partner J.W. Perry and counsel Jack Orford are providing finance advice. Partner Brian D. Hirsch and associate Nicholas Soilleux are providing real estate advice. Partner Adam Kaminsky is providing executive compensation advice. Partner Pritesh P. Shah is providing intellectual property advice. Partners Martine M. Beamon and Dana M. Seshens are providing litigation advice. Members of the Davis Polk team are based in the New York and Washington DC offices.
